stimulusHtml: An ideal gas in a closed container of variable volume experiences an increase in temperature while the pressure remains unchanged. What happens to the average kinetic energy of the molecules and the volume of the gas as the temperature increases?
choicesHtml:
Average Kinetic Energy Volume
Decreases. Volume Remains unchanged
Average Kinetic Energy Volume
Decreases Increases

Average Kinetic Energy: Remains unchanged. Volume: Increases

Average Kinetic Energy Volume
Remains unchanged Increases

 

Average Kinetic Energy Volume
Increases Remains unchanged
Average Kinetic Energy Volume
Increases Increases
